class.name: CATPathElement
class.abstract: Class representing a path of objects.

constructor.name: CATPathElement
constructor.abstract: Constructs the class from an object.

method.name: AddBrotherElement
method.abstract: Adds one object as brother of the current position of the path or just at the right of a given object.

method.abstract: Adds one object at the end of the path or just beneath a given object.

method.name: AddFatherElement
method.abstract: Adds one object at the top of the path or just above a given object.

method.abstract: Increments the reference count for the given interface.

method.abstract: Retrieves a pointer to the brothers' list of the input object.

method.abstract: Retrieves a new list enclosing the children list of the input object.

method.abstract: Returns a pointer to a new path of objects which is the clone of the current one.

method.abstract: Retrieves a pointer to the current big brother of the path.

method.abstract: Retrieves a pointer to the current object of the path.

method.abstract: Finds a given object anywhere into the path.

method.abstract: Finds one object in the path adhering to a given interface.

method.abstract: Retrieves the interactive context.

method.abstract: Retrieves the current position.

method.abstract: Retrieves the size of the path.

method.abstract: Retrieves a sub-path resulting from the search of one object in the path which adheres at least to one interface of a given list of interfaces.

method.abstract: Initialize a bottom-up run of the path.

method.abstract: Initialize a top-down run of the path.

method.name: NextRightElement

method.name: Release
method.abstract: Decrements the reference count for the given interface.

method.name: RemoveElement
method.abstract: Removes one object from the path.

method.name: Reverse
method.abstract: Reverse the current path.

method.abstract: Assignment operator.

method.name: operator ==
method.abstract: Equality operator.

method.name: operator []
method.abstract: Returns the (i+1)th object of the path.
